pullRequest.title: BREAKING CHANGE: Improves extending ImportHandlers and refactors the Metrics API

commit.message: Improves the logging and documentation for troubleshooting.

Uses a more flexible method signature for extractors.

These callbacks are required to extract a value from an entity
when performing an export. As some extractors not only operate
on the entity itself but on additional data structures, we need to
relax the type here a little.

Delegates resolving custom / computed fields to EntityImportHandlerExtenders.

An EntityImportHandlerExtender can provide additional mappings to export.
In order to resolve these mappings into fields (for the docs and also to generate
column labels), we have to also resolve them into a FieldDefinition - therefore
we have to also delegate this task to the EntityImportHandlerExtender.

Permits to attach multiple customFieldHandlers.

An BaseImportHandler will always register itself as
custom field provider (to invoke its EntityImportHandlerExtenders)
and also the ExportJob will register itself to provide even more ways
of extending the output. Therefore we need to support multiple
handlers.

Improves the exports of performance flags.

We now use a custom mapping to completely hide the
internal implementation (previously the "flags" field was
shown as numeric instead as string list).
Sorts properties alphabetically - no other changes..

BREAKING: Refactors the metrics framework to use a fluent query API.

The heavily reduces the amount of single methods required to build
various common queries.

Also a fast lookup cache is now installed so further speed up the framework
for common queries.
Fixes an IllegalStateException by providing a WebContext before building filters.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -20,4 +20,14 @@ per month and an additional **best effort** one which tries to execute the compu
 day in the current month, so that the relected values are up to date (as long as the system 
 isn't overloaded).
 
+For maintenance and troubleshooting some options are available:
+* The [AnalyticsCommand](AnalyticsCommand.java) can be used in the [System Console](https://localhost:9000/system/console)
+by calling **analytics**. This lists all active schedulers, their queue and last execution. It also permits
+to forcefully start a scheduler imedietally.
